data.title: Recently Published Works in Holocaust and Genocide Studies
data.text:
Most of the entries in this bibliography were catalogued in the Online Computer Library Center (OCLC) database between August 1 and November 30, 2009. This search is based largely on pre-publication information; titles may have been changed or cancelled.

Reference Works

Adamczyk-Garbowska, Monika, Adam Kopciowski, and Andrzej Trzciński, eds. Tam był kiedyś mój dom: Księgi pamięci gmin żydowskich. Lublin: Uniwersytetu Marii Curie-Sklodowskiej, 2009. 631 pp., ill., map. Jews, Poland, bibliography.

Fuchs, Richard. Life Science: Eine Chronologie von den Anfängen der Eugenik bis zur Humangenetik der Gegenwart. Berlin: Lit, 2008. i + 512 pp., ill., bibl., ind. National Socialism and medicine.

Grosvald, Sara, ed. Antisemitism: An Annotated Bibliography, 2005. vol. 21. Munich: De Gruyter, 2009. 322 pp.

Hein, Dörte. Erinnerungskulturen online: Angebote, Kommunikatoren und Nutzer von Websites zu Nationalsozialismus und Holocaust. Konstanz: UVK, 2009. 294 pp., ill., bibl. Computer network resources, collective memory.

Hill, Brad Sabin, ed. Partial Guide to the Kiev Archival Collections, Excluding the I. Edward Kiev Papers, Record Groups K0002, K0003, K0004, K0005. Washington, DC: George Washington University, 2009. iii + 18 pp.

Klee, Ernst. Das Kulturlexikon zum Dritten Reich: Wer war was vor und nach 1945. Frankfurt/M: Fischer Taschenbuch, 2009. 648 pp., bibl. National Socialism and art, dictionaries.

Mallmann Showell, Jak. Hitler's Navy: A Reference Guide to the Kriegsmarine, 1935-1945. Barnsley, UK: Pen & Sword, 2009. 223 pp., ill., bibl., ind.

Midlarsky, Manus I. Handbook of War Studies III: The Intrastate Dimension. Ann Arbor: University of Michigan Press, 2009. xviii + 370 pp., ill., bibl., ind., maps.

Winstone, Martin. The Holocaust Sites of Europe: An Historical Guide. London: I. B. Tauris, 2010. 448 pp.

The Holocaust and Other Nazi-Era Crimes

Achcar, Gilbert. The Arabs and the Holocaust: The Arab-Israeli War of Narratives. San Francisco: Saqi Books, 2010. 400 pp.

Apel, Linde, ed. In den Tod geschickt: Die Deportation von Juden, Roma und Sinti aus Hamburg, 1940 bis 1945. Sent to Their Deaths: The Deportations of Jews, Roma, and Sinti from Hamburg 1940 to 1945. Berlin: Metropol, 2009. 288 pp., ill. + DVD. Exhibition catalog.

Bachoud, Andrée, and Bernard Sicot. Sables d'exil: Les républicains espagnols dans les camps d'internement en Maghreb (1939-1945). Perpignan, France: Mare Nostrum, 2009. 316 pp., ill, bibl.

Barkahan, Menachem, ed. Vernichtung der Juden in Lettland 1941-1945: Eine Vortragsreihe. Riga: Shamir, 2008. 331 pp., ill., bibl. [End Page 149]

Bauer, Yehuda. The Death of the Shtetl. New Haven, CT: Yale University Press, 2010. 224 pp., bibl., ind.

Belco, Victoria. War, Massacre, and Recovery in Central Italy, 1943-1948. Toronto: University of Toronto Press, 2009. 592 pp., bibl., ind.

Bergmann, Ingo. Und erinnere dich immer an mich: Gedenkbuch für die Ulmer Opfer des Holocaust. Ulm, Germany: Klemm & Oelschläger, 2009. 183 pp., ill., bibl. + register of names.

Berkhoff, Karel. De onbekende massagraven van Oekraïne. Vught, the Netherlands: Nationaal Monument Kamp Vught, 2009. 35 pp. Holocaust, Ukraine.

Bikont, Anna. My z Jedwabnego. Jinočany, Czech Republic: H & H, 2008. 616 pp., bibl., ind., maps. Pogroms, Poland.

Blatman, Daniel, and Nicolas Weill. Les marches de la mort: La dernière étape du génocide nazi. Été 1944-printemps 1945. Paris: Fayard, 2009. 589 pp., ill., bibl., ind., maps.

Böhler, Jochen. Der Überfall: Deutschlands Krieg gegen Polen. Frankfurt/M: Eichborn, 2009. 271 pp., ill., bibl., ind.

Bowinkelmann, Pia. Schattenwelt: Die Vernichtung der Juden, dargestellt im französischen Dokumentarfilm. Hannover: Offizin, 2008. 434 pp., bibl. Holocaust as reflected in motion pictures.

Busmann, Petra. Frankfurt am Main—Frauen-KZ Ravensbrück: Lebensspuren verfolgter Frauen. Bad Homburg, Germany: VAS, 2009. 125 pp., ill., bibl., maps.

Chudy, Zbigniew. Zbrodnie niemieckie w Wieluniu w latach 1939-1945: Tamte godziny, tamte dni, tamte lata. Wrocław: Nortom, 2009. 217 pp., ill., bibl. Atrocities, Poland, aerial operations, Łódź.

Constante, Mariano, and Manuel Razola. Triángulo azul: Los republicanos españoles en Mauthausen. Zaragoza, Spain: Gobierno de Aragón, 2008. 207 pp., ill., bibl.

Čovo, Stjepan. "Trolist mučenika": Franjevačke provincije Presvetog. Otkupitelja. Sinj, Croatia: Franjevacki samostan, 2008. 62 pp., ill. Christian martyrs, Croatia.

Dieckmann, Christoph, and Babette Quinkert, eds. Im Ghetto 1939-1945: Neue Forschungen zu Alltag und Umfeld...

Project MUSE Mission

Project MUSE promotes the creation and dissemination of essential humanities and social science resources through collaboration with libraries, publishers, and scholars worldwide. Forged from a partnership between a university press and a library, Project MUSE is a trusted part of the academic and scholarly community it serves.
